meta.title: Engineering Technology Radar
meta.subtitle: Q1 2025 Edition
meta.summary: A curated view of the engineering practices, tools, platforms, and languages that matter most to our delivery teams.

rings.name: Adopt
rings.description: Proven techniques we leverage on the majority of projects.

rings.name: Trial
rings.description: Promising options we evaluate with limited scope.

rings.name: Hold
rings.description: Approaches we deliberately avoid for now.

quadrants.name: Techniques
quadrants.description: Delivery and collaboration practices that influence how we build software.

blips.name: Outcome-oriented roadmaps
blips.description: Roadmaps expressed as measurable outcomes keep teams aligned without over-prescribing solutions.

blips.name: Contract testing at scale
blips.description: Teams are expanding consumer-driven contracts across business domains to reduce integration failures.

blips.name: AI-generated release notes
blips.description: We are experimenting with language models to summarize change logs for stakeholders.

blips.name: Manual regression sign-off
blips.description: High-touch release gates slow feedback loops; replace with automated quality signals whenever possible.

quadrants.name: Platforms
quadrants.description: Runtime and delivery platforms that underpin our products.

blips.name: Internal developer portal
blips.description: A golden path portal centralizes service templates, documentation, and paved road automation.

blips.name: Edge runtime observability
blips.description: Distributed tracing for edge workers gives us deeper visibility into CDN execution.

blips.name: Vector databases as a service
blips.description: Hosted vector stores simplify semantic retrieval but add vendor lock-in considerations.

blips.name: Self-managed Kubernetes clusters
blips.description: We prefer managed control planes to focus talent on product differentiation instead of plumbing.

quadrants.name: Tools
quadrants.description: Developer tools and automation that accelerate delivery.

blips.name: Shared UI kits
blips.description: Well-governed component libraries maintain UX consistency across squads.

blips.name: Spec-driven API linting
blips.description: Automated OpenAPI linting in CI enforces consistent API ergonomics.

blips.name: Generative test authoring
blips.description: We are exploring copilots that draft regression scenarios for reviewers to refine.

blips.name: Monolithic CI pipelines
blips.description: Long-running linear pipelines slow feedback and impede trunk-based development.

quadrants.name: Languages & Frameworks
quadrants.description: Programming languages and frameworks our teams rely on.

blips.name: TypeScript 5.x
blips.description: Type-safe tooling combined with excellent DX keeps TypeScript as our default web language.

blips.name: Rust for backend services
blips.description: Select teams are piloting Rust services for compute-intensive workloads.

blips.name: WASM UI frameworks
blips.description: WebAssembly-based UI stacks remain niche but intriguing for specific offline scenarios.

blips.name: Server-side templating only
blips.description: Modern interactive experiences benefit from progressive enhancement beyond static templates.
